ARABIC: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا فَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِم بَابًا ذَا عَذَابٍ شَدِيدٍ إِذَا هُمْ فِيهِ مُبْلِسُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: until We open to them a gate to a harsh punishment in which they will at once be crushed by despair.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So that when at last We open up the gate of severe punishment on them they will be overwhelmed with despair.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: until We opened upon them the door of a severe chastisement. Then lo, in this state they become utterly despaired of any good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: until We opened the gate of greater torment (death) and they suddenly found themselves in despair.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: To the extent that when We opened the gate of a severe punishment for them, they thereupon lie despairingly in it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Until, when We open for them the gate of severe punishment, then lo! they will be plunged in despair.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Until when We open upon them a door of severe chastisement, lo! they are in despair at it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: until, when We open against them a door of terrible chastisement, lo, they are sore confounded at it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Until, when We open for them the gate of extreme punishment, behold! they are aghast thereat.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: until We open before them a gate of harsh punishment and then they will be dumbfounded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Until when we shall open upon them a portal of severe torment, and lo! thereat they are desparing
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: until We open on them the gate of a severe punishment, whereupon they will be despondent in it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Until We open on them a gate leading to a severe Punishment: then Lo! they will be plunged in despair therein!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Until, when We open for them the gate of severe punishment, then lo! They will be plunged into destruction with deep regrets, sorrows and in despair.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: when We opened on them a gate of severe punishment, they utterly despaired.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Until, when We have opened before them a gate of intense agony, at once they will despair.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Until when We have opened before them a door of severe punishment, immediately they will be therein in despair.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [23:77] Until (hattā is for inceptiveness), when We opened on them the gate of a severe chastisement, namely, the day of Badr, slaying [them], behold! they are aghast thereat, despairing of anything good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Until) give them respite, Muhammad, until (when We open for them the gate of extreme punishment) i.e. of hunger, (behold! they are aghast thereat) they despair of all goodness.
